channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Junior Perl Developer who needs a career boost?
item.description: Taking the journey from Junior to Senior â€“ and building a strong work history â€“ is a lot more fun in the right job

item.description: For the junior developer looking to boost their skills while enjoying their time at a great company

item.title: Senior Perl developer with an interest in NodeJS needed
item.description: I mean, sure, some architects like designing port-a-potties. But most want to build a skyscraper. Soâ€¦hereâ€™s your skyscraper

item.title: A website for Yancy
item.description: Doug Bell gave a talk "A website for Yancy" at Chicago Perl Mongers recently.

item.title: Code::TidyAll::Plugin::TestCount
item.description: Another gem from our very own Shlomi Fish. You can use to ascertain that the test plan agrees with the Test::Count annotations.

item.title: Perl on Embedded Devices
item.description: The workshop is going to be conducted by Jens Rehsack. It is very popular workshop, if you are planning to attend then please book it as early as possible.

item.title: Whatâ€™s imposter syndrome and how can you overcome it in 2019?
item.description: Chloe, from Eligo, talks about Imposter Syndrome and how to deal with it.

item.title: LiteCLI - SQLite Client with Autocomplete
item.description: LiteCLI is a new open source command line client with many good features. Built in Python it is hosted on GitHub.

item.title: bless is good parts of Perl language
item.description: Yuki started very interesting discussion about the "bless" feature of perl. There are few interesting comments at the end. Must read for any perl lover.

item.title: Writing Reusable Controllers
item.description: The article talks about the most mis-used feature 'Controllers' of Mojolicious.

item.title: Plans for Riga
item.description: Dave Cross shares his plans for Riga.

item.title: Projects using Mojolicious
item.description: Doug Bell created a web page listing his work based on Mojolicious framework. Highly recommended.

item.title: #392 - Time to submit talk/workshop
item.description:
Hi there

Last one week, I have noticed surge in submitting talks/workshops to The Perl Conference in Riga. If you are planning to attend the conferencec then I would recommend submit a talk proposal as well. If you are into perl training, like Dave Cross, then why not even submit a workshop. There are already bunch of talks/workshops already submitted as I see listed here.

I have also submitted a talk proposal titled "CPAN Contributors - Do's and Dont's". Dave Cross has written a very nice blog about "Plans for Riga".

Last but not the least, Doug Bell, who took over the charge of "CPAN Testers" from Barbie, recently compiled a webpage listing all his work using the Mojolicious framework.

Have fun reading the newsletter and please don't forget to share with your friends.
